Text: And the series is done.  I'll be going out of town on vacation for the next 2 weeks, so I wanted to get this final season out before then.  When I get back I will begin posting Farscape in high quality.  Seasons 1 and 2 have been ripped and encoded...working on season 3 right now.  After all 4 seasons of Farscape are uploaded I will be doing both Stargate Atlantis and Star Trek Voyager in high quality...just not sure what order yet.  Enjoy!!

Thanks for all the great uploads meech - go check your PM at the forum. Is Babylon 5 on the list at a later stage?

Its a great scifi series, but the dvd's aren't great quality given when is was made and its native 4:3. So maybe a slightly lower quality setting might do...

Thanks Meechorno!!

But i disagree with what he said about having a lower setting. I like getting the best possible quality from these shows you are uploading and i would MUCH rather have large files with the best quality possible. 

Thanks and im really looking forward to Voyager and Farscape!!!!!

Useless due to .MKV format. .MKV is dead dude.
mkv is dead?  I thought it was new.  I know the three media players on my laptop all have issues playing it.  These are high quality but mkv is not for me.

First a big tanks to meech for the encode and the upload.
mkv is very much alive and unlike mp4 which is a propitiatory format it's open source and free so developers don't need to pay royalties to iso/iec or ieee (actuality apple developed the mp4/mov container but the iso guys in their wisdom made it part of the mpeg 4 standard part 12 I believe), If you prefer mp4 get ffmpeg and convert the files without reencoding with the command
ffmpeg -i Star.Trek.DS9-s07e01.Image.in.the.Sand.mkv -vcodec copy -acodec copy Star.Trek.DS9-s07e01.Image.in.the.Sand.mp4
but you better use a descent player and don't waist your time reencoding, on a pc use mpc-hc, on Linux vlc and enjoy.

And a question
I thought that of Star Trek was recorded in Stereo did Paramount reedit the original audio sources to get 5+1? what's the point of 5+1 surround sound for a Stereo source?
